definitions.definition: place or insert between one thing and another.
examples: he interposed himself between her and the top of the stairs
synonyms: put "he interposed himself between the girls"

examples: the legislature interposed to suppress these amusements
synonyms: muscle in "they interposed to uphold the truce"

examples: if I might interpose a personal remark here
synonyms: put in; informalslip in "I must interpose a note of caution"

definitions.definition: exercise or advance (a veto or objection) so as to interfere.
examples: the memo interposes no objection to issuing a discharge
